cardRulings.question: If a token is sent to Treyst & Rossum's controller's Reserve during the Afternoon, does Treyst gain a counter as the token is removed from the game?
cardRulings.answer: No. The tokens do leave the Expedition zone and enter the Reserve (or discard pile if they were Fleeting), but being removed from the game does not qualify as "leaving the Reserve".

cardRulings.answer: Yes. You always resolve the effects "as much as you can".

cardRulings.question: If a card that has an effect over the next card played "this Afternoon", such as Foundry Engineer, is somehow played outside of the Afternoon, what happens?
cardRulings.answer: "This Afternoon" refers to the Afternoon of the current day, so there are two possibilities : 1. The card is played before, such as during Noon, in which case it will apply to the next corresponding card of the Afternoon. 2. The card is played after, such as during Dusk or Night, in which case it won't have any effect.

cardRulings.answer: Yes. (1 card per turn is a rule of thumb, specific effects can cause exceptions.)

cardRulings.question: If my opponent controls a card such as Robin Hood that affects the cost of Characters when Coppélia is supposed to be played "for free", will I need to pay mana?
cardRulings.answer: Coppelia is played for free! Playing a card for free means bypassing its cost entirely, which is different from reducing it to zero.

cardRulings.question: Does Coppelia gain Fleeting when played for free via her effect?
cardRulings.answer: Yes, unless something else prevents it, a card played for free follows the other rules, such as becoming Fleeting when played from Reserve.

cardRulings.question: If Coppelia is played for free thanks to a Quick Action, such as the power of Treyst & Rossum, does it end the turn?
cardRulings.answer: No. If the resolution of Quick Action includes playing a card, the turn continues normally.

cardRulings.question: If another effect somehow sends Coppelia to the discard pile after she joins the Reserve from hand but before she's played, can she be played from discard?
cardRulings.answer:
In general, effects and abilities which affect a card when it's in a specific zone cannot track it if it changes zones unless they specifically mention this zone change. 
When Coppelia goes to Reserve from hand, her effect can find her in Reserve to play her because it specifically mentions this possibility, and it can find her in the Expedition zone to give her Asleep because, again, its effect mentions playing her.
However, no part of the effect refers going to the discard pile (unlike a Moonlight Jellyfish which mentions "When I'm sacrificed") so it cannot find the card in the discard to play it.

cardRulings.question: How does the Foundry, Axiom Bastion interact with the Council?
cardRulings.answer: In general, if an effect tells you to do something and another tells you that you cannot, the negative effect wins. The Foundry has no effect on Characters played in front of the Council.

cardRulings.answer: Yes. First you play the card, then its {j} abilities activate, so the other effect is already active when the {j} effect takes place.  Note that you're not doing a "Resupply" effect.

cardRulings.question: Does the replacement effect of the Axiom version of "Ouroboros, Lyra Bastion" count as Resupply for effects such as Quetzalcoatl?
cardRulings.answer: No. Note that it doesn't count as drawing cards either.

cardRulings.question: If I control the Rare, Axiom version of "The Ouroboros, Lyra Bastion" and I do an Exhausted Resupply, what happens?
cardRulings.answer: An Exhausted Resupply is a (special case of) Resupply, and will get fully replaced by the effect of the Bastion. You'll therefore reveal two cards, put one in Reserve, and won't exhaust it.

cardRulings.question: What happens if Jeanne d'Arc moves from an Expedition to another, because of Hooked for example?
cardRulings.answer: Nothing special! The Expedition zone includes all the expeditions from all players, so Jeanne d'Arc does not leave the Expedition zone.

cardRulings.question: What happens when Jeanne d'Arc goes to Reserve at Night?
cardRulings.answer: 1. During Rest, your card of Jeanne d'Arc goes to Reserve along with all your (non-Anchored, non-Asleep, etc...) Characters.  2. This triggers her effect 3. Once you've finished resolving step 1, you resolve the effect, creating two Ordis Recruit tokens.  4. Since your Characters already left, the tokens don't go to Reserve until next turn (at which point they will be removed from the game, being tokens).

cardRulings.question: In which order does the effect of Moonlight Jellyfish resolves when it's sacrificed?
cardRulings.answer: 1. The controller of Moonlight Jellyfish declares they sacrifice it. 2. Moonlight Jellyfish reaction is triggered, depending on whether it's Fleeting or not. 3. Moonlight Jellyfish goes to discard. 4. After the effect that sacrificed it is resolved, Moonlight Jellyfish reaction (or any other reactions still in Limbo at that moment) can be resolved.

cardRulings.question: Did the wording of this card change?
cardRulings.answer:
The first printing of The Foundry, Axiom Bastion said "{T} : Activate the {r} triggers of the next Character you play from your hand this turn."

future printings will say:
"{T} : The next Character you play from your hand this turn activates its {r} abilities (as if it had been played from Reserve)."

cardRulings.question: How does the Foundry, Axiom Bastion interact with an effect that prevents the activation of abilities, such as the Council?
cardRulings.answer: In general, if an effect tells you to do something and another tells you that you cannot, the negative effect wins. The Foundry has no effect on Characters played in front of the Council.

cardRulings.question: Does Tough protect Achilles from Sabotage?
cardRulings.answer: No. Unless stated otherwise, Cards in Reserve have no effect, save their Support Ability (in the colored box).

cardRulings.question: If my opponent uses a Spell or ability talking about "target Character" and all my Characters are Tough, what happens?
cardRulings.answer: When your opponent casts a Spell or resolve an ability that can target one of your Tough Characters, they decide if they want to pay the extra mana to make one of your Tough Character a valid target. If they choose not to (because they don't have enough mana, or because they don't want to), the effect resolves as if your Characters were untargettable.  Depending on the effect, it might mean the effect may simply do nothing, or it might mean they must target one of their own Characters.

cardRulings.question: If the Tough Character of my opponent is the only possible target of my Spell of ability, do I have to pay extra mana?
cardRulings.answer:
No. If you choose to pay extra Mana, the Tough Character becomes a valid target. If you choose not to, and there's no valid target, the effect might do nothing.

Don't forget that Characters you control may be valid targets: if you choose not to pay the extra mana (or if you can't), you may have to target them!

cardRulings.question: If my opponent uses a Spell or ability talking about "target Character" and all my Characters are Tough, what happens?
cardRulings.answer: When your opponent casts a Spell or resolve an ability that can target one of your Tough Characters, they decide if they want to pay the extra mana to make one of your Tough Character a valid target. If they choose not to (because they don't have enough mana, or because they don't want to), the effect resolves as if your Characters were untargettable.  Depending on the effect, it might mean the effect may simply do nothing, or it might mean they must target one of their own Characters.

cardRulings.question: What happens if a card gets Tough from different sources?
cardRulings.answer: The effects stack! If you have 2 "the Spindle, Muna Bastion" in your Landmarks, your cards have Tough 4.

cardRulings.question: Did the wording of this card change?
cardRulings.answer:
The first printing of the Council said "The {j}, {h} and {r} triggers of Characters facing me don't activate." 
Future printings will say "The {j}, {h} and {r} abilities of Characters facing me can't activate."

cardRulings.question: How does a card that say "activate the abiliy of a Character" such as Ganesha (Muna) interact with the Council?
cardRulings.answer: Ganesha has no effect if he's played opposite the Council. If he's played in a different Expedition, it still cannot trigger a Character facing the council : when an effect says you can do something and another effect says you cannot, the one who says "you can't" applies.

cardRulings.question: How does the Foundry, Axiom Bastion interact with the Council?
cardRulings.answer: When an effect says you can do something and another effect says you cannot, the one who says "you can't" applies. So if a Character is played in front of the Council, none of its effects activate, with or without the Foundry.

cardRulings.answer: You either pay extra Mana, target another Character, or don't use her power.

cardRulings.question: Did the wording of this card change?
cardRulings.answer: The first printing of Sakarabru said "Your opponent's Expedition facing mine moves backwards one region."  Future printings will say "Your opponent's Expedition facing me moves backwards one region."

cardRulings.question: What happens if Sakarabru is played during the tiebreaker?
cardRulings.answer: In the Arena, Expeditions can't move forward nor backwards since there's only one Region. Any such effect becomes irrelevant.

cardRulings.answer: The first printing of this card said: "You may activate the {j} triggers of target Permanent you control."  Future printings will say "You may activate the {j} abilities of target Permanent you control."

cardRulings.answer:

cardRulings.answer: The controller of Mighty Jinn still has the option of sending it to their Mana zone.

cardRulings.question: Can I target a Character in my Reserve?
cardRulings.answer: No. Characters in Reserve are not controlled.

cardRulings.question: What kind of dice should I use ?
cardRulings.answer: A (balanced) six-sided die.  "On a 6+" is there because some cards, such as Martengale, allow you to increase the result of the die, possibly beyond 6.

cardRulings.question: Do the "When played from Hand/Reserve" abilities of the card played by Auraq activate?
cardRulings.answer: Cards played from the top of the deck activate their {j} abilities (not the abilities from Hand nor Reserve).

cardRulings.question: If an effect, such as Robin Hood, increases the cost of my cards, do I need to pay mana when I play them via Auraq & Kibble's effect?
cardRulings.answer: A free card remains free!  Playing a card for free means bypassing its cost entirely, which is different from reducing it to zero.

cardRulings.question: When 2 Ouroboros Inkcaster go to Reserve at the same time, can they send each other back to hand?
cardRulings.answer: Yes: their effects are triggered as they leave the Expedition zone (before the —), but the output is resolved once they've arrived in Reserve. You resolve them in the order of your choice, but the effect of the first Inkcaster to return to hand is still pending, despite the card not being in the Expedition at that time.

cardRulings.question: Do the {j) and {r} abilities of the Characters put in play by Mind Apotheosis activate?
cardRulings.answer: The arrow {j} means "when I enter the Expedition zone or Landmark zone" (the player aids in starter decks simplify this into "When I'm played from anywhere"). In the case of Mind Apotheosis, cards are not played but put in the Expedition, but they do trigger their {j} abilities.

cardRulings.question: What does "put in the Expedition" means?
cardRulings.answer: It means the cards are not considered "played" and therefore won't trigger effects such as "Atsadi & Surge" or "Auraq & Kibble".

cardRulings.question: What happens if two players meet the victory conditions of Lyra Festival the same Dusk?
cardRulings.answer: They resolve in turn order, so the player that's earlier in the turn order wins.

cardRulings.question: When do we check the resolution of Lyra Festival?
cardRulings.answer: "At Dusk" effects are triggered at the beginning of the Dusk phase, before progression. Note that the check for three Characters satisfying the criteria happens upon triggering, at the beginning of Dusk (it's before the — ), not upon resolution. Other "At Dusk" effects cannot change the result for this Day.

cardRulings.question: What happens if two players meet the victory conditions of Lyra Festival the same Dusk?
cardRulings.answer: At Dusk, (or At Noon, At Night, etc...) all such effects go simultaneously in the pool of effects (Limbo) then in turn order, each player resolves all their effects. So the player that's earlier in turn order wins.

cardRulings.question: What happens if a player plays a card for free, such as with The Kadigir, Yzmir Bastion, while their opponent controls Robin Hood?
cardRulings.answer: A free card remains free even against Robin Hood!  Playing a card for free means bypassing its cost entirely, which is different from reducing it to zero.

cardRulings.question: Was this card updated ?
cardRulings.answer:
Yes. The first printing of Robin Hood said  "Characters your opponents play cost {1} more."  Future printings will say  "Characters your opponents play can't cost less than {2}. (If they would cost less, they cost {2} instead.)"

This change impacts all versions of this effect, including the ones found on Unique cards. Any card that uses the previous wording should be read as if it used the new one. Any card that uses the previous wording should be read as if it used the new one.

cardRulings.question: If I control Robin Hood, can my opponent reduce the cost of a card using an effect such as Martengale?
cardRulings.answer: They can, but if this would bring the card cost under 2, the cost would remain 2.

cardRulings.question: If a card that has an effect over the next card played "this Afternoon" is somehow played outside of the Afternoon, what happens?
cardRulings.answer: "This Afternoon" refers to the Afternoon of the current day, so there are two possibilities : 1. The card is played before, such as during Noon, in which case it will apply to the next corresponding card of the Afternoon. 2. The card is played after, such as during Dusk or Night, in which case it won't have any effect.

cardRulings.question: What happens if Small Step, Giant Leap is played during the tiebreaker?
cardRulings.answer: In the Arena, Expeditions can't move forward nor backwards since there's only one Region. Any such effect becomes irrelevant.

cardRulings.question: If I play "Small Step, Giant Leap" while my Expeditions are adjacent, do I win immediately?
cardRulings.answer: As soon as the effect has fully resolved, yes.

cardRulings.question: Can Celebration Day stop Small Step, Giant Leap?
cardRulings.answer: Yes. In general, if an effect tells you to do something and another tells you that you cannot, the negative effect wins. Celebration Day prevents your Expedition from moving forward during the Day. If Small Step, Giant Leap is played on that Expedition during that Day, it will have no effect.

cardRulings.question: If my opponent controls a card such as Robin Hood that affects the cost of Characters when Coppélia is supposed to be played "for free", will I need to pay mana?
cardRulings.answer: Coppelia is played for free! Playing a card for free means bypassing its cost entirely, which is different from reducing it to zero.

cardRulings.question: Does Coppelia gain Fleeting when played for free via her effect?
cardRulings.answer: Yes, unless something else prevents it, a card played for free follows the other rules, such as becoming Fleeting when played from Reserve.

cardRulings.question: If Coppelia is played for free thanks to a Quick Action, such as the power of Treyst & Rossum, does it end the turn?
cardRulings.answer: No. If the resolution of Quick Action includes playing a card, the turn continues normally.

cardRulings.question: If another effect somehow sends Coppelia to the discard pile after she joins the Reserve from hand but before she's played, can she be played from discard?
cardRulings.answer:
In general, effects and abilities which affect a card when it's in a specific zone cannot track it if it changes zones unless they specifically mention this zone change. 
When Coppelia goes to Reserve from hand, her effect can find her in Reserve to play her because it specifically mentions this possibility, and it can find her in the Expedition zone to give her Asleep because, again, its effect mentions playing her.
However, no part of the effect refers going to the discard pile (unlike a Moonlight Jellyfish which mentions "When I'm sacrificed") so it cannot find the card in the discard to play it.

cardRulings.question: How does Ganesha interact with the Council?
cardRulings.answer: In general, if an effect tells you to do something and another tells you that you cannot, the negative effect wins. If Ganesha is played facing the Council, it doesn't have any special effect. If it is played facing the other Expedition, it still cannot activate the triggers of Characters facing the Council.

cardRulings.answer: They resolve in turn order, so the player that's earlier in turn order wins.

cardRulings.question: When do we check the resolution of Lyra Festival?
cardRulings.answer: "At Dusk" effects are triggered at the beginning of the Dusk phase, before progression. Note that the check for three Characters satisfying the criteria happens upon triggering, at the beginning of Dusk (it's before the — ), not upon resolution. Other "At Dusk" effects cannot change the result for this Day.

cardRulings.question: If my opponent uses a Spell or ability talking about "target Character" and all my Characters are Tough, what happens?
cardRulings.answer: When your opponent casts a Spell or resolve an ability that can target one of your Tough Characters, they decide if they want to pay the extra mana to make one of your Tough Character a valid target. If they choose not to (because they don't have enough mana, or because they don't want to), the effect resolves as if your Characters were untargettable.  Depending on the effect, it might mean the effect may simply do nothing, or it might mean they must target one of their own Characters.

cardRulings.question: If my opponent uses a Spell or ability talking about "target Character" and all my Characters are Tough, what happens?
cardRulings.answer: When your opponent casts a Spell or resolve an ability that can target one of your Tough Characters, they decide if they want to pay the extra mana to make one of your Tough Character a valid target. If they choose not to (because they don't have enough mana, or because they don't want to), the effect resolves as if your Characters were untargettable.  Depending on the effect, it might mean the effect may simply do nothing, or it might mean they must target one of their own Characters.

cardRulings.question: What happens if a card gets Tough from different sources?
cardRulings.answer: The effects stack! If you have 2 "the Spindle, Muna Bastion" in your Landmarks, your cards have Tough 4.

cardRulings.question: Do I create tokens with Quetzalcoatl for the morning drawing of cards of my opponents?
cardRulings.answer: If Quetzalcoatl is in your Expeditions (because it was Asleep or Anchored for example), you create a token for each opponent that draws during Morning.

cardRulings.question: Do I create one or two tokens with Quetzalcoatl if my opponent Resupplies twice, for example thanks to the rare version of Harvest?
cardRulings.answer: As of this ruling, there is no possible way to Resupply two cards simultaneously. If your opponent Resupplies twice, he's first drawing the first card, then the second, which means you'll create two tokens.

cardRulings.question: If a card that has an effect over the next card played "this Afternoon", such as Foundry Engineer, is somehow played outside of the Afternoon, what happens?
cardRulings.answer: "This Afternoon" refers to the Afternoon of the current day, so there are two possibilities : 1. The card is played before, such as during Noon, in which case it will apply to the next corresponding card of the Afternoon. 2. The card is played after, such as during Dusk or Night, in which case it won't have any effect.

cardRulings.question: What happens if a Gigantic Character is played during the tiebreaker?
cardRulings.answer: Its statistics are counted twice: once for the Hero Expedition, once for the Companion Expedition.

cardRulings.question: If a Character is both Gigantic and Defender, for example because I control both Atlas (Rare, Ordis version) and Gulrang & Tocsin, what happens?
cardRulings.answer: "My Expedition", for a Gigantic Character, means "my Expeditions", plural.  Therefore a Defender, Gigantic Character would prevent both of its Expeditions from moving forward.

If they choose not to (because they don't have enough mana, or because they don't want to), the effect resolves as if your Characters were untargettable.  Depending on the effect, it might mean the effect may simply do nothing, or it might mean they must target one of their own Characters.

cardRulings.question: If the Tough Character of my opponent is the only possible target of my Spell of ability, do I have to pay extra mana?
cardRulings.answer:
No. If you choose to pay extra Mana, the Tough Character becomes a valid target. If you choose not to, and there's no valid target, the effect might do nothing.

Don't forget that Characters you control may be valid targets: if you choose not to pay the extra mana (or if you can't), you may have to target them!

cardRulings.question: Did the wording of this card change?
cardRulings.answer:
The first printing of the Council said "The {j}, {h} and {r} triggers of Characters facing me don't activate." 
Future printings will say "The {j}, {h} and {r} abilities of Characters facing me can't activate."

cardRulings.question: How does the Foundry, Axiom Bastion interact with the Council?
cardRulings.answer: When an effect says you can do something and another effect says you cannot, the one who says "you can't" applies. So if a Character is played facing the Council, none of its {j}, {m} or {r} abilities activate, with or without the Foundry, Axiom Bastion.

cardRulings.question: How does Ganesha interact with the Council?
cardRulings.answer: Ganesha has no effect if he's played facing the Council. If he's played in a different Expedition, it still cannot trigger a Character facing the council : when an effect says you can do something and another effect says you cannot, the one who says "you can't" applies.

cardRulings.question: What happens if Jeanne d'Arc moves from an Expedition to another, because of Hooked for example?
cardRulings.answer: Nothing special! The Expedition zone includes all the expeditions from all players, so Jeanne d'Arc does not leave the Expedition zone.

cardRulings.question: What happens when Jeanne d'Arc goes to Reserve at Night?
cardRulings.answer: 1. During Rest, your card of Jeanne d'Arc goes to Reserve along with all your (non-Anchored, non-Asleep, etc...) Characters.  2. This triggers her effect 3. Once you've finished resolving step 1, you resolve the effect, creating two Ordis Recruit tokens.  4. Since your Characters already left, the tokens don't go to Reserve until next turn (at which point they will be removed from the game, being tokens).

cardRulings.question: Was this card updated ?
cardRulings.answer:
Yes. The first printing of Robin Hood said  "Characters your opponents play cost {1} more."  Future printings will say  "Characters your opponents play can't cost less than {2}. (If they would cost less, they cost {2} instead.)"

This change impacts all versions of this effect, including the ones found on Unique cards. Any card that uses the previous wording should be read as if it used the new one.

cardRulings.question: What happens if a player plays a Character for free, such as with Auraq & Kibble's effect, while their opponent controls Robin Hood?
cardRulings.answer: A free card remains free even against Robin Hood!  Playing a card for free means bypassing its cost entirely, which is different from reducing it to zero.

cardRulings.question: If I control Robin Hood, can my opponent reduce the cost of a card using an effect such as Martengale?
cardRulings.answer: They can, but if this would bring the card cost under 2, the cost would remain 2.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: Charaktere, die dein Gegner spielt, können nicht weniger als {2} kosten. (Falls sie weniger kosten würden, kosten sie stattdessen {2}.)

cardRulings.question: What happens if a player plays a card for free, such as with The Kadigir, Yzmir Bastion, while their opponent controls Robin Hood?
cardRulings.answer: A free card remains free even against Robin Hood!  Playing a card for free means bypassing its cost entirely, which is different from reducing it to zero.

cardRulings.question: Was this card updated ?
cardRulings.answer:
Yes. The first printing of Rare Robin Hood said  "#Cards# your opponents play cost {1} more."  Future printings will say  "#Cards# your opponents play can't cost less than {2}. (If they would cost less, they cost {2} instead.)"

This change impacts all versions of this effect, including the ones found on Unique cards. Any card that uses the previous wording should be read as if it used the new one.

cardRulings.question: What happens during tie-breaker if Thoth is in my Expedition, but neither player wins and there's a second tiebreaker Day?
cardRulings.answer: In the Arena, Expeditions don't move forward nor backwards since there's only one Region. Any such effect becomes irrelevant. They cannot "fail to move forward" either.

cardRulings.question: What does "after Rest" mean?
cardRulings.answer: "After Rest" means after Characters have returned to Reserve, but before the Clean-Up when players choose which cards to keep in their Reserve and Landmarks zone.

cardRulings.question: Does "Celebration Day" prevent an Expedition from moving through special effects such as "Small Step Giant Leap"?
cardRulings.answer: In general, if an effect tells you to do something and another tells you that you cannot, the negative effect wins. "Small Step, Giant Leap" has no effect on an Expedition that has been blocked by Celebration Day.

cardRulings.question: What does it mean to "sacrifice a Character"?
cardRulings.answer: To sacrifice a Character means "discard a Character that you control." You only control Characters in your Expeditions.

cardRulings.question: What happens if two different effects change the Region type of a Region?
cardRulings.answer: If several effects change a Region type in a contradictory manner, the last one to be played prevails. If that effect stopped applying (for example if the Kraken was the last card played and is removed from the Expedition zone), it reverts to the previous state.

cardRulings.question: If a card that has an effect over the next card played "this Afternoon" is somehow played outside of the Afternoon, what happens?
cardRulings.answer: "This Afternoon" refers to the Afternoon of the current day, so there are two possibilities : 1. The card is played before, such as during Noon, in which case it will apply to the next corresponding card of the Afternoon. 2. The card is played after, such as during Dusk or Night, in which case it won't have any effect.

cardRulings.answer: The first printing of Moonlight Jellyfish read: "When I'm sacrificed, if I'm not [FLEETING] — Put me in Reserve." Future printings will read: "When I'm sacrificed, if I was not [FLEETING] — Put me in Reserve."

cardRulings.question: In which order does the effect of Moonlight Jellyfish resolves when it's sacrificed?
cardRulings.answer: 1. The controller of Moonlight Jellyfish declares they sacrifice it. 2. Moonlight Jellyfish reaction is triggered, depending on whether it's Fleeting or not. 3. Moonlight Jellyfish goes to discard. 4. After the effect that sacrificed it is resolved, Moonlight Jellyfish reaction (or any other reactions still in Limbo at that moment) can be resolved.

cardRulings.question: What happens if two different effects change the Region type of a Region?
cardRulings.answer: If several effects change a Region type in a contradictory manner, the last one to be played prevails. If that effect stopped applying (for example if the Kraken was the last card played and is removed from the Expedition zone), it reverts to the previous state.

cardRulings.question: Can I play the Kraken if I have no Characters in my Expeditions?
cardRulings.answer: Yes, but you will sacrifice the Kraken.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: [Gigantisch]. (Ich werde in jeder deiner Expeditionen als anwesend betrachtet.)  {J} Opfere zwei Charaktere.  Alle Regionen sind {O} und verlieren ihre anderen Gelände.

cardRulings.question: What happens if the Kraken is played during the tiebreaker?
cardRulings.answer: Its statistics are counted twice: once for the Hero Expedition, once for the Companion Expedition. In addition, the Arena is now only {O} so statistics in {M} or {V} won't help.

cardRulings.question: Did the wording of this card change?
cardRulings.answer: The first printing of Sakarabru said "Your opponent's Expedition facing mine moves backwards one region."  Future printings will say "Your opponent's Expedition facing me moves backwards one region."

cardRulings.question: What happens if Sakarabru is played during the tiebreaker?
cardRulings.answer: In the Arena, Expeditions can't move forward nor backwards since there's only one Region. Any such effect becomes irrelevant.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: {H} Die Expedition deines Gegners, die mir gegenübersteht, bewegt sich eine Region zurück.

cardRulings.question: What happens if "Small Step, Giant Leap" is played during the tiebreaker?
cardRulings.answer: In the Arena, Expeditions can't move forward nor backwards since there's only one Region. Any such effect becomes irrelevant.

cardRulings.question: If I play "Small Step, Giant Leap" while my Expeditions are adjacent, do I win immediately?
cardRulings.answer: As soon as the effect has fully resolved, yes.

cardRulings.question: Can "Celebration Day" stop "Small Step, Giant Leap"?
cardRulings.answer: Yes. In general, if an effect tells you to do something and another tells you that you cannot, the negative effect wins. Celebration Day prevents your Expedition from moving forward during the Day. If Small Step, Giant Leap is played on that Expedition during that Day, it will have no effect.

cardRulings.answer: You pay extra mana for each Character with Tough.

cardRulings.question: What happens if I use the Kadigir to cast a Spell such as Off You Go! or Kraken's Wrath on a Tough target?
cardRulings.answer: You cast it for free!

cardRulings.question: What happens I play a card for free with The Kadigir, Yzmir Bastion, while my opponent controls a card that increases the cost of my Spells, such as the Rare version of Robin Hood?
cardRulings.answer: A free card remains free!  Playing a card for free means bypassing its cost entirely, which is different from reducing it to zero.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: {T} : Der nächste Zauber, den du in dieser Runde spielst, ist kostenlos.

cardRulings.question: What happens if Maw leaves the Expedition zone?
cardRulings.answer: It's removed from the game, like any other token.

cardRulings.question: If I sacrifice two Characters simultaneously, for example with the Kraken, what happens to Maw?
cardRulings.answer: Maw gains 4 Boosts.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: Wenn du einen Charakter opferst — Ich erhalte 2 Verstärkungen.

Von dir gespielte Zauber mit Handkosten {1} oder weniger haben [[Vergänglich]].  Wenn du einen Zauber spielst — Ein Charakter deiner Wahl, den du kontrollierst, erhält 1 Verstärkung. (Dies geschieht, wenn der Effekt abgeklungen ist. Eine Verstärkung ist ein +1/+1/+1-Zähler. Entferne sie, wenn sie die Expeditionszone verlässt.)
